item.title: Roblox: Prior Extinction Codes (August 2024)
item.description:
Prior Extinction is a unique RPG that stands out from other Roblox experiences due to its realistic graphics, complex mechanics, and interesting concept. Here, you can play the role of various dinosaurs, hunt, or simply survive, which is quite exciting, considering the well-designed visuals.

By redeeming Prior Extinction codes, you will receive generous rewards from the developers that will greatly help you progress in the game and become a powerful dinosaur. So, if you are looking for an easy and fast way to earn hard-to-find resources, this is exactly what you need.

All Prior Extinction Codes

Working Prior Extinction Codes

  • GemFix - Redeem this code to get 5 Opals.
  • JurassicUpdate - Redeem this code to get 5 Opals, 1 Fossil, and 1 Amber.
  • PrismaticEventFix - Redeem this code to get 5 Opals, 1 Fossil, and 1 Amber.
  • TunnelDweller - Redeem this code to get 2,500 Amber.
  • Laacer - Redeem this code to get a Mahajangasuchus.
  • WoofWoof - Redeem this code to get 2,500 Amber.
  • PostTV - Redeem this code to get a Mahajangasuchus.

Expired Prior Extinction Codes

  • Easter
  • 2yearsBirthday

Whether you're a beginner or an experienced player, redeeming Prior Extinction codes will be equally beneficial. Each code offers a variety of resources and other stuff that will definitely come in handy, so be sure to take advantage of this opportunity.

How to Redeem Codes in Prior Extinction

Since Prior Extinction is significantly different from most other Roblox games, even experienced players may have trouble redeeming codes. So, if you don't understand how to do it or can't find the desired option, follow the steps below:

  • Launch Prior Extinction .
  • Select the desired game mode: Roleplay or Survival.
  • Then, you will be taken to the server selection menu. Select the desired one or a random one by clicking the "Join Random Server" button.
  • Wait until you are connected to the server, and in the new menu, click on the Play button.
  • After doing this, you will finally be taken to the main menu of the game. Pay attention to the left side of the screen. There will be several buttons arranged in a column. Among them, interact with the one that says Codes.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a white "Use Code" button below it. Now, enter manually, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the "Use Code" button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, a notification will appear above the redemption menu with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More Prior Extinction Codes

In addition to this page, you can find more Roblox codes on the game's official social media pages. There, along with other content posted by the developers, they often share codes, so be sure not to miss them:

  • Official Prior Extinction Roblox group.
  • Official Prior Extinction Discord server.
  • Official Prior Extinction X account.
  • Official Prior Extinction YouTube channel.

item.title: Roblox: Don't Press The Button X Codes (August 2024)
item.description:
Don't Press The Button X offers players to take part in various competitions, such as escaping from a huge shark. By winning, you will earn Coins, which are necessary for purchasing various useful items. However, there is a way to get money from the first minutes of the game, namely using Don't Press The Button X codes.

With these codes, players can earn a lot of coins in this Roblox experience. However, their validity is limited, so if you do not hurry, they will expire and the rewards will no longer be available to you.

All Don't Press The Button X Codes

Working Don't Press The Button X Codes

  • angry - Redeem this code to get 150 Coins
  • release - Redeem this code to get 500 Coins
  • button - Redeem this code to get 150 Coins
  • 80kmembers - Redeem this code to get 500 Coins

Expired Don't Press The Button X Codes

There are no expired codes in Don't Press The Button X . We will update this article as soon as more codes become available.

As the name suggests, in Don't Press The Button X , you have to press the Button. By doing so, all players on the island will be randomly assigned to one of the challenges. It could be something as harmless as King of the Hill. Also, you might be unlucky and have to dodge a meteor shower. In either case, winning will earn you valuable Coins. But if you're constantly losing, then Don't Press The Button X codes are what you need.

Don't Press The Button X codes are a great source of Coins. Just a few of these codes will allow you to purchase some pretty expensive items in the Shop. But it's worth noting that they only last for a limited time, so you should use the codes as quickly as possible.

How to Redeem Don't Press The Button X Codes

As with other Roblox experiences, using Don't Press The Button X codes is easy. However, you should do it in the lobby, as it can lead to your death during a round. So, follow these simple steps to get free rewards:

  • Launch Don't Press The Button X .
  • Then, click on the codes button, which is on the left side of the screen.
  • After that, enter the code and click the Redeem button.
  • If you did everything correctly, then in a moment you will see a message about receiving your free goodies.

How to Get More Don't Press The Button X

As you can see, these Roblox codes are very valuable. Therefore, we recommend you bookmark this article as we are going to update it over time. Alternatively, you can visit the developers' social media:

  • Fun-Tastic Games Roblox Group

item.title: Warzone: How To Fix Stuttering In The Battle Royale
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Fix Warzone Stuttering
  • How To Roll Back NVIDIA Graphics Drivers For Warzone

Stuttering in Call of Duty: Warzone is a particularly frustrating issue impacting players dropping into the action. With Season 5 of the battle royale in full swing, the loss of frames and lag during Call of Duty: Warzone matches often determines which player becomes the last one standing.

The competitive nature of Call of Duty: Warzone matches means the slightest lapse in performance results in players taking an early trip to the Gulag or even all the way back to the main menu if the loss of performance is significant enough. The Season 5 update introduced significant updates and despite the best efforts of Raven Software, the issues keep appearing. Thankfully, there are a handful of workarounds to ensure high frame rates and stuttering stop impacting the action.

How To Fix Warzone Stuttering

With the Call of Duty: Warzone cycle now deep into its fourth year, the community has found several workarounds to stop the battle royale from freezing in the middle of a hotly-contested firefight. Below is a closer look at some proven solutions on how to address stuttering once and for all.

The first solution is exclusively for PC Call of Duty: Warzone players who encounter sudden drops in frame rate and stuttering that's enough to disrupt the action. In some scenarios, the battle royale decides to default to the Fullscreen Borderless setting which is a cause of low frame rates and input lag. Before dropping out of the entry plane, head into the Settings tab and select the Fullscreen Exclusive option .

How To Roll Back NVIDIA Graphics Drivers For Warzone

Another cause of stuttering in Call of Duty: Warzone is an up-to-date graphics card. Sometimes, the fresh driver isn't optimized for gameplay which is where rolling it back to an older version has its benefits. Here's how to roll back an NVIDIA graphics driver:

  1. Open the PC's Device Manager
  2. Click on the Display Adapters option
  3. Select the graphics card and open the Drivers tab
  4. Click the Roll Back Driver button
  5. Restart the PC

If the ability to roll back the NVIDIA graphics driver isn't available, players can manually install it before reintroducing an older driver that doesn't cause Call of Duty: Warzone to stutter at inconvenient moments. Here's how to manually install a graphics driver:

  1. Select the Uninstall Driver option on the graphics card
  2. Visit the NVIDIA website and click on the GeForce Drivers tab
  3. Find the graphics card that's installed in the PC
  4. Select an old driver from the list provided
  5. Restart the PC

Check Weapon Motion Blur

If a rolled-back graphics card still results in frame drop and stuttering, there's another useful workaround that involves tinkering with the Call of Duty: Warzone settings. In previous chapters of the battle royale, weapon motion blur has impacted the frame rate at the beginning of matches on PC and consoles.

With multiple players often landing in one location of the map at the same time to obtain the best JAK Cataclysm loadout, any loss of performance can be the difference between a quick return to the pre-game lobby or a chance to climb aboard the victory helicopter.

If none of the fixes above have stopped Call of Duty: Warzone from stuttering, a full reinstall of the game can rectify any issues. This process can take several hours depending on internet connection speed so be sure to try all other issues beforehand.

item.title: 8 Games With Realistic Swimming
item.description:
Highlights

  • Water in games adds vertical exploration, and realistic swimming mechanics can enhance immersion.
  • Games like London 2012 and Subnautica prioritize swimming mechanics to create realistic experiences.
  • Titles like ABZU and Grand Theft Auto 5 showcase beautiful swimming animations for players to enjoy.

If land allows players to explore in two directions, water adds a whole new vertical dimension to exploration thanks to diving mechanics. Even though not all games make swimming a part of their gameplay, it’s a fun inclusion that can sometimes help mix up the mundane land traversal. And when swimming mechanics are realistic, it just adds to the immersion.

But making swimming in video games similar to its real-life counterpart is easier said than done, and most games don’t really make it a priority. Thankfully, there are a handful of titles that take water traversal seriously, and the swimming mechanics in these games are second to none. From backstrokes and breaststrokes in some games to underwater exploration and combat in others, these titles prove that there’s no limit to how realistic swimming mechanics in video games can be.

8 London 2012: The Official Game

Allows Players To Use Different Swimming Techniques

  • Platforms: PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, Android, iOS, PC
  • Released: June 2012
  • Developer: Sega
  • Genre: Simulation

Almost every four years, Olympic games are held worldwide, and numerous countries take part in different sports of all categories. To complement the Olympics and help the audience also become a part of these sports, an officially licensed Olympic video game is released alongside the event.

The London 2012: The Official Game was the last realistic-looking Olympic video game before they got somewhat cartoonish and added unrealistic mechanics like perks and boosts. This title lets Olympic enthusiasts take part in a variety of Olympic sports, with swimming being one of the most fun activities to do. In this title, players can race against AI opponents in freestyle, backstroke, and breaststroke races. The character animations are executed superbly, and there is a surprising amount of detail in every action, considering how old this title is.

7 Stranded Deep

Impressive Swimming Animations And Realistic-Looking Water

As the name suggests, the title is directly inspired by Tom Hank's Cast Away movie, where the character is stranded on an island alone surrounded by thousands of miles of ocean all around. This no-combat survival game will have players hunting for food, crafting supplies, and monitoring their vitals at all times to stay alive.

Swimming is one of the core mechanics of this video game, and the developers left nothing to the imagination. The animations are top-notch, dynamic lighting inside the water makes everything feel more realistic, and players will have to keep an eye out for dangerous flora and fauna when exploring the vast sea.

6 ABZU

Provides A Beautiful Scuba Diving Adventure

Abzu is arguably one of the prettiest games to come out in recent years. The entire game revolves around underwater exploration, and it features some of the smoothest swimming mechanics and animations ever seen in a game. Sound and music play a crucial role in immersing players in this underwater paradise as the game sends them on a mission to introduce marine life into lifeless areas of the ocean to restore order.

The entire game takes place underwater, with a special emphasis being placed on the environment and puzzle-solving elements. Players who like scuba diving will instantly fall in love with the beautiful and vibrant world of Abzu , and when they’re done with the game, this world will surely stay in their minds for a long while.

5 Subnautica

A Scary Yet Beautiful Underwater Journey

People with thalassophobia should steer clear of Subnautica . As beautiful as planet 4546B is, it's equally scary and daunting. The protagonist of the game, Ryley, is a survivor of a spacecraft crash who’s stranded on a water-filled planet with very little land cover. The world of Subnautica is far deeper than one can initially imagine. It's divided into various biomes and filled with flora and fauna that are exclusive to each one. Players start out exploring this planet using nothing but their arms and legs to swim around until they are able to craft better traversal tech to help them move around faster.

Subnautica ’s swimming really stands out due to the details. The visual outline of the character’s goggles and their breathing sounds through the oxygen mask when underwater make the experience truly immersive. The deeper the player goes, the faster Ryley will begin to breathe, which also adds a sense of realism.

4 Grand Theft Auto 5

Incredibly Realistic Swimming Mechanics And Visuals

Even this late in its life, Grand Theft Auto 5 has more realistic swimming mechanics than many games that came out afterward. Players can swim freely in GTA 5, and some of the best missions even taking place underwater, making swimming a crucial element.

Everything from the animations when swimming in or on lakes and oceans and the fabric distortions as either of the three characters pushes against the water to how their clothes realistically get wet when entering water and dry when they stand out in the open screams realism.

3 Assassin’s Creed 4: Black Flag

A Bright And Vivid Ocean For Players To Get Lost In

When talking about realistic swimming games, a pirate game has to make it into the list. Within that category, there could be no better game than Assassin’s Creed 4: Black Flag , with Edward Kenway taking charge in the fight against the templars.

For the first time in an Assassin’s Creed game, players can explore the game’s version of the Mediterranean Sea and take on boats both large and small in a naval battle. And when that gets boring, Edward can swim the ocean at his leisure and even explore underwater shipwrecks in the huge open world.

2 Shadow Of The Tomb Raider

Features Believable Swimming And Diving Mechanics

Lara Croft’s newest adventure is filled to the brim with adventure, action, exploration, and a whole lot of dirt and grime. To wash off the mud, Lara takes it to the waters, with the game bringing back underwater traversal and, occasionally, even combat.

The previous entries in the Tomb Raider reboot trilogy always had exceptional animations and graphics, and in Shadow of the Tomb Raider , Eidos Montreal turns the dial up to eleven in every way conceivable. The game pays special attention to Lara’s swimming and diving mechanics, which are executed with acute attention to detail, from how Lara moves in standing vs. moving water to how her clothes develop creases realistically with every stroke.

1 The Witcher 3: The Wild Hunt

Great Swimming Animations And Convincing Water Physics

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is praised for many things, including its story, its characters, its world, its amazing side missions, and the overall quality of the game. Something that doesn’t stand out on its own but still deserves credit, however, is the swimming sections.

Geralt can jump off a boat and swim in lakes or take a dive and go underwater as he struggles to push against water due to the weight of his armor. The animations and the water physics are top-notch, and it's clear that CD Projekt Red took great care when designing the aquatic aspects.

item.title: 7 Open-World Games With The Best Dialogue Systems
item.description:
Dialogue is one of the most important features of many games, especially for the likes of RPGs, as players will likely need to talk to NPCs to discover quests or various contexts for the world they are a part of. However, it isn't just RPGs that have incredible dialogue systems, as some of these role-playing games also contain amazing open worlds for the player to explore.

These games focus on more than implying giving players a variety of activities to complete within the world around them but instead, also allow them to have conversations with those they meet. These dialogue systems make the open-world titles feel more alive as players can really get involved in the world around them. Therefore, these are by far the best dialogue systems in open-world games.

8 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Players Are Able To Express Themselves In Many Different Ways

Open-world games don't require the player to have a voiced protagonist for the dialogue system to be impressive in an open-world experience. The classic RPG title Skyrim has a surprisingly high-praised dialogue system that allows players to express their character in various ways within the dialogue available among the different NPCs they are likely to encounter while adventuring across the open world.

This is especially seen when completing various quest lines, such as the Dark Brotherhood where the player can give into their dark side when they encounter their assassination targets, as they can confidently walk up to them and talk to them to scare them before their death. This includes talking to NPCs during random encounters while they explore.

7 Dragon Age: Inquisition

A Dialogue Wheel That Shows Emotions

Some players may not consider Dragon Age: Inquisition to be an open-world game. However, unlike the other titles in the franchise, Inquisition has a focus on larger separate maps of different areas in Thedas that give the player the feeling of an open world experience, as they can freely travel between the different areas. Like any Dragon Age title, dialogue is a vital aspect of the RPG experience, with players being able to make not only choices but also react in different ways to the events that are occurring around them.

One highlighted way that Inquisition does this is players being able to give an emotional response to something that is defined by different images. Players can react to something confused, angry, supportive, or upset, as well as many other emotions that the Inquisitor is able to display through the player's choice.

6 Fallout 4

The Charisma Skill Makes All The Difference

Bethesda has made a variety of open-world RPGs across various themes that don't just include the Elder Scrolls franchise, with the Fallout franchise being another with an impressive dialogue system that Bethesda has continued to experiment with. Fallout 4 was the first Fallout game in the franchise to use a voiced protagonist and this meant that the dialogue system had to be done slightly differently.

Players may not know the exact words they are responding with, but they can either be friendly, sarcastic, or aggressive towards the NPCs they encounter. Not to forget to mention that the charisma skill also played a vital role in bribing, threatening, or even flirting with some of the NPCs.

5 Assassin's Creed Odyssey

Cassandra Or Alexios Can Have Their Personality Defined

Assassin's Creed is a franchise that has seen many changes happen to it over the years. Besides, the game becoming far more open world as seen in Assassin's Creed Odyssey, where players are able to travel between the different Greek islands, players are also able to be far more interactive with the various characters they encounter during both the main story and side quests of the title.

This allowed players to define the main character of Assassin's Creed Odyssey more. Unlike past games in the franchise where players were given characters that were already established in their personality and reacted on their own without giving places a choice in the franchise.

4 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Speech Plays An Important Role In Defining The Story

The Witcher 3 is an action RPG that allows the player to once again take on the role of Geralt the monster hunter in an epic adventure. While players are freely allowed to explore the open world of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, the dialogue system within this RPG is one of the best, not only for talking to NPCs but also due to the importance it has to the story.

Depending on how the player chooses to react to the people around them, they can even define which ending players get once they finally finish The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt. This includes specific combat skills to be used in dialogue too.

3 Cyberpunk 2077

Being Skilled In Specific Things Adds Further Context

CD Projekt Red expanded upon not only their open worlds but also their dialogue systems when they later created Cyberpunk 2077 . Talking is a large factor in Cyberpunk 2077 , as players are able to interact with not only the regular NPCs but also define their character through the relationship they have with the man inside their head, Johnny Silverhand.

Besides the regular dialogue options, depending on the skills the player has and the attributes they invest points in, players will even have a unique dialogue to do with those things, making each V they create feel unique in their own way. While the attribute of Cool is the most common for getting a good deal or winning someone over, Body can still have its uses in dialogue too, such as intimidating someone.

2 Disco Elysium

Chatting In The Open World Grows The Character

Out of all the open-world games, one that pushes the dialogue system in gaming above and beyond the others is Disco Elysium . Talking is a vital part of the player discovering more about their character as they play a detective that must solve a crime while they themselves have completely lost their memory. Through the different emotions within them, players are able to react in different ways to the people they encounter within the open world to make every attempt at the RPG feel different.

From focusing on a more dramatic character that tends to overreact in conversations, to instead being a very aggressive person. Discovering the positives and negatives of the character the player has created is by far one of the most interesting aspects of talking in Disco Elysium.

1
